maybe. What's your specific need?
have you set your BIOS to boot up from the CD drive?
do you see anything happening before the blank screen?
you have have unusual video hardware that the automatic probing used by the live CD can't deal with
there are some options for 'safe video' in the boot-up menu of the live CD

also there is a CD-image called 'altinstall' that does not attempt to use graphics (it boots in text-mode with menus) that in my experience always works even when the regular CD fails due to video problems
I see. Well the alternate image is probably your best bet then
do you mean what commands to burn the CD?
you shouldn't need any special commands with the altinstall image; it's supposed to boot directly into the installer which will start asking you installation questions in menu form
